wpPost.title: Office365 Roadmap
wpPost.content:
Office365 Roadmap

A cool thing that not many people knows, is how the Office365 is dealing with requests from Community. There is actually a Roadmap that everyone that keep up with andÂ lists updates that are currently planned for applicable subscribers. Updates are at various stages from being in development to rolling-out to customers to being generally available for applicable customers world-wide.

A curious thing to know are the latest releases as:

  • SharePoint Server 2016 – Feature Pack 1 (FP1)
  • SharePoint mobile app for iOS – News rollup
  • SharePoint mobile app for Android
  • SharePoint mobile app for Windows 10
  • SharePoint Online site collection storage limit increase – 25TB
  • SharePoint Online – modern lists experience
  • SharePoint Online â€“ Client-side Web Part for Existing SharePoint Pages
  • SharePoint Online â€“ Webhooks on SharePoint Document Libraries
  • SharePoint Online – SharePoint Framework

And what’s rolling out next?

  • Integrated modern file copy for 500MB files
  • Conditional access policies for location and app
  • SharePoint Online – create team site and Office 365 group from SharePoint home (this one is cool!)
  • SharePoint Online – team newsarrow right
  • SharePoint – modern team sites plus Office 365 Groups integration (ready to use our modern webparts)

You can check more info here:Â https://products.office.com/en-us/business/office-365-roadmap?filters=sharepoint
